perturbation.original_text: 2.6 "Sponsorship Benefits" means the benefits Newegg will provide Allied, including the license granted in Section 6.1 and the fee stated in Schedule 3. 2.7 "Sponsorship Rights" means the bundle of rights, services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg as set out in Schedule 4, which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.6 "Sponsorship Benefits" means the financial contributions Newegg will provide Allied, including the fee stated in Schedule 3. 2.7 "Sponsorship Rights" means the bundle of services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg as set out in Schedule 4, which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has specific inclusion of "license granted in Section 6.1" in "Sponsorship Benefits". Modified text removes this, and only indicates "financial contributions". Therefore the benefits are up to interpretation and it leads to a conflict in what are the responsibilities and definitions of the 'Sponsorship Benefits'.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Allied Obligations and Newegg Sponsorship Obligations 4.1 Allied shall provide, by the license granted in Section 5.1 and otherwise as appropriate, to or for the benefit of Newegg, the Sponsorship Rights, including generally providing advertising space in all of Allied's media and participation in Allied's marketing activities relating to the Arena 4.2 Newegg shall provide to Allied the Sponsorship Benefits set out in Schedule 3, including paying the Sponsorship Fee as provided in that Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Allied Obligations and Newegg Sponsorship Obligations 4.1 Allied shall provide, by the license granted in Section 5.1 and otherwise as appropriate, to or for the benefit of Newegg, the Sponsorship Rights, including generally providing advertising space in all of Allied's media and participation in Allied's marketing activities relating to the Venue 4.2 Newegg shall provide to Allied the Sponsorship Benefits set out in Schedule 3, including paying the Partner Fee as provided in that Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has specifically mentioned "Arena" and "Sponsorship Fee". Modified version replaces "Arena" with "Venue" and "Sponsorship Fee" with "Partner Fee". There will be an unclear understanding whether those terms "Venue" and "Partner Fee" are the same as "Arena" and "Sponsorship Fee" respectively which leads to conflicting interpretations and arguments.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Newegg grants Allied a revocable, non-transferrable, non-assignable (whether voluntarily, or as a result of a change of control, or by operation of law), non-sublicensable, non-exclusive and limited license to use, during the Term, the Newegg Marks solely in connection with Allied's marketing and conduct of the Arena. 6.2 Allied acknowledges and agrees that Newegg has valuable goodwill and reputation in the Newegg Marks and that Newegg is and shall be at all times the sole and exclusive owner of rights, including Intellectual Property Rights, in and related to the Newegg Marks.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Newegg grants Allied a revocable, non-transferrable, non-assignable (whether voluntarily, or as a result of a change of control, or by operation of law), non-sublicensable, non-exclusive and limited authorization to use, during the Term, the Newegg Marks solely in connection with Allied's marketing and conduct of the Allied Premises. 6.2 Allied acknowledges and agrees that Newegg has valuable goodwill and reputation in the Newegg Logos and that Newegg is and shall be at all times the sole and exclusive owner of rights, including Intellectual Property Rights, in and related to the Newegg Logos.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifically mentioned "license" and "Arena" and "Newegg Marks". Modified version replaces "license" with "authorization", "Arena" with "Allied Premises", and "Newegg Marks" with "Newegg Logos". There will be an unclear understanding whether those terms "authorization", "Allied Premises", and "Newegg Logos" are the same as "license", "Arena", and "Newegg Marks" respectively which leads to conflicting interpretations and arguments.
